title.narrative: CHILD CARE

description.narrative: The child and social protection systems are strengthened to provide consolidated interventions to ensure the right of every child to live in a caring and supportive family environment, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, boys and girls, especially most disadvantaged, benefit from effective national and local policies that support nurturing family and social environment to attain high standard of development, health, learning and well-being

participating-org.narrative: REGIONAL DIRECTORATE FOR SOCIAL ASSISTANCE BURGAS
REGIONAL DIRECTORATE FOR SOCIAL ASSISTANCE STARA ZAGORA

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The child and social protection systems are strengthened to provide consolidated interventions to ensure the right of every childto live in a caring and supportive family environment

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the continuation of the national implementation of child care reform and deinstitutionalization process in line with the national strategic documents; technical assistance is provided for the development of all legislative framework relevant to the Social Services Act and for strengthening the supervision for social service workforce; 1,125 families and 1,680 children from vulnerable and isolated communities benefited from outreach and preventive services, supported by UNICEF CO in one region of the country; and976 parents and 1,277 children were reached by the mobile teams established underthe pilot project “EU Child Guarantee” in Bulgaria.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022

title.narrative: An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country (23-03-L3-01), Text

baseline.value: New Social Services Act is available

target.value: 2022:Legal amendments in line with the planned measures in the DI Action Plan

actual.value: 2021:TA provided for development of by-laws to the Social Services Act.
